item.title: 波音和 Spirit AeroSystems 高层将在 NTSB 听证会上就 MAX 9 紧急事件作证
item.description: 美国国家运输安全委员会表示，波音公司和 Spirit AeroSystems 公司的多位高管将在周二开始的为期两天的听证会上就阿拉斯加航空公司波音 737 MAX 9 型客机一月份发生的机舱门堵塞紧急事件作证。【原文：The National Transportation Safety Board said a number of Boeing and Spirit AeroSystems executives will testify at a two-day hearing starting Tuesday on the January Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 MAX 9 in-flight door plug emergency.】

item.title: 6 投资者对全球股市下跌的评论
item.description: 周一，全球股市暴跌，债券反弹，原因是人们担心美国可能会走向衰退，投资者纷纷逃离风险资产，同时打赌利率必须迅速下降才能挽救经济增长。【原文：Share markets around the world tumbled and bonds rallied on Monday as fears the United States could be heading for recession sent investors rushing from risk assets while wagering interest rates will have to fall rapidly to rescue growth.】

item.title: 经济数据疲软引发衰退担忧，美国银行股暴跌
item.description: 由于担心经济衰退，投资者纷纷逃离这个与经济健康状况密切相关的行业，转向避险资产，美国银行股周一大幅下挫。【原文：U.S. bank stocks slumped on Monday as fears of a recession sent investors fleeing from a sector closely tied to the health of the economy and toward safe-haven assets.】

item.title: 美国五州推动马斯克修复人工智能聊天机器人的选举误报问题
item.description: 美国五个州的州务卿周一敦促亿万富翁埃隆-马斯克修复社交媒体平台 X 的人工智能聊天机器人，称其传播了与 11 月 5 日大选有关的错误信息。【原文：Secretaries of state from five U.S. states urged billionaire Elon Musk on Monday to fix social media platform X's AI chatbot, saying it had spread misinformation related to the Nov. 5 election.】

item.title: 市场散发 "黑色星期一 "气氛，股市下跌
item.description: 本周伊始，全球市场进入全面下挫模式，波动率创下单日最高纪录，股票期货和加密货币暴跌，唤起了人们对过去危机的回忆。【原文：Global markets have kicked off the week in full selloff mode, with measures of volatility shooting up by the most on record in a single day, while equity futures and cryptocurrencies plummet, reviving memories of past crises.】

item.title: 与美国经济相比，全球市场崩溃更多与廉价资金结束有关
item.description: 分析师说，最近几天全球股市的崩盘更多反映的是投资者为增加赌注而进行的套利交易的清盘，而不是美国经济前景的急剧变化。【原文：A meltdown in world equity markets in recent days is more reflective of a wind-down of carry trades used by investors to juice their bets than a hard and fast shift in the U.S. economic outlook, analysts say.】

item.title: 美国能源数据大幅修正令交易员和分析师一头雾水
item.description: 美国官方石油消费数据的一连串大幅修正令依赖这些数据进行交易的市场参与者感到不安。【原文：A string of dramatic revisions to official U.S. oil consumption data have unnerved market participants who rely on the figures to trade.】

item.title: 英特尔首席执行官表示，英特尔正在采用 ASML 的另一款高 NA 工具
item.description: 英特尔公司首席执行官 Pat Gelsinger 在 8 月 1 日的财报电话会议上表示，英特尔正在接收 ASML 价值 3.5 亿欧元（3.83 亿美元）的第二台新 "High NA "EUV 工具。【原文：Intel is in the process of receiving the second of ASML's new 350 million euro ($383 million) "High NA" EUV tools, CEO Pat Gelsinger said, according to a transcript of the company's Aug. 1 earnings call.】

item.title: 美国 7 月服务业反弹，就业率也有所回升
item.description: 由于订单和就业人数增加，7 月份美国服务业活动从四年低点反弹，这可能有助于消除上个月失业率飙升引发的对经济衰退的担忧。【原文：U.S. services sector activity rebounded from a four-year low in July amid a rise in orders and employment, which could help to quash fears of a recession that were sparked by a surge in the unemployment rate last month.】

item.title: Downdetector 显示数千用户的在线交易平台瘫痪
item.description: 在线交易平台 Charles Schwab、Fidelity Investments 和 TD Ameritrade 周一有数千名用户出现故障，根据故障跟踪网站 Downdetector.com 的数据。【原文：Online trading platforms Charles Schwab , Fidelity Investments and TD Ameritrade were down for thousands of users on Monday, according to outage tracking website Downdetector.com.】

item.title: 经济担忧令收益率跌至一年低点，2/10 曲线转为正值
item.description: 周一，美国国债收益率跌至一年多低点，国债收益率曲线中受到密切关注的部分两年来首次转为正值，原因是人们越来越担心美国可能会步入衰退。【原文：U.S. Treasury yields dropped to more than one-year lows on Monday and a closely watched part of the Treasury yield curve turned positive for the first time in two years on increasing concerns that the United States may be heading into a recession.】

item.title: 股市下滑，华尔街 "恐惧指数 "盘中创纪录大涨
item.description: 华尔街最受关注的投资者焦虑指数周一创下了有史以来最大的盘中跳水幅度，美国股指期货因市场对美国可能陷入衰退的担忧加剧而暴跌。【原文：Wall Street's most watched gauge of investor anxiety logged its largest ever intraday jump on Monday, as U.S. stock futures tumbled on rising fears the United States could be tipping into recession.】

item.title: 美联储主席古尔斯比告诉CNBC，美国看起来并未陷入衰退
item.description: 芝加哥联邦储备银行行长奥斯坦-古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）周一表示，虽然上周五的美国就业数据弱于预期，但看起来并不像经济衰退，但美联储官员需要认识到环境的变化，以避免在利率方面限制过多。【原文：Chicago Federal Reserve Bank President Austan Goolsbee on Monday said while the U.S. employment data on Friday was weaker than expected, it does not look like a recession, but that Fed officials need to be cognizant of changes in the environment to avoid being too restrictive with interest rates.】

item.title: 泰森食品公司肉类销售反弹，季度业绩超出预期
item.description: 本周一，泰森食品公司（Tyson Foods）第三季度收入和利润超出华尔街预期，原因是肉类产品销售反弹，同时谷物价格下跌降低了动物饲料成本。【原文：Tyson Foods surpassed Wall Street expectations for third-quarter revenue and profit on Monday as sales of meat products rebounded while lower grain prices reduced costs for animal feed.】

item.title: 苹果、英伟达领衔的 "华丽七巨头 "价值将缩水 1 万亿美元
item.description: 周一，苹果和英伟达（Nvidia）引领了科技股的抛售潮，原因是对美国经济衰退的担忧以及伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）减持 iPhone 制造商股份的决定刺破了该行业长达数月的涨势。【原文：Apple and Nvidia led a sell-off in technology stocks on Monday as U.S. recession fears and Berkshire Hathaway's decision to cut its stake in the iPhone maker punctured a months-long rally in the sector.】

item.title: 与通用电气和波音公司达成抵消协议后，波兰更接近购买阿帕奇直升机
item.description: 波兰国防部周一与波音公司和通用电气公司签署了价值近 10 亿兹罗提（约合 2.55 亿美元）的抵消协议，使其更接近于敲定一项价值 120 亿美元的购买 96 架 AH-64E 阿帕奇直升机的协议。【原文：Poland's defence ministry signed offset deals with Boeing and General Electric worth nearly 1 billion zlotys ($255 million) on Monday, bringing it closer to finalising a $12 billion agreement to buy 96 AH-64E Apache helicopters.】

item.title: 日元回升让高歌猛进的日本公司重回人间
item.description: 日元升值导致日本股市在周一跌回谷底，使投资者急于判断盈利前景可能恶化，并扼杀了东京市场长达数月的大幅上涨。【原文：A resurgent yen helped bring Japanese stocks crashing back to earth on Monday, leaving investors scrambling to gauge the potentially diminished outlook for earnings, and snuffing out a months-long dramatic run by the Tokyo market.】

item.title: 据《纽约时报》报道，埃隆-马斯克重启对 Sam Altman 和 OpenAI 的诉讼
item.description: 据《纽约时报》周一报道，亿万富翁埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）重启了对 ChatGPT 制造商 OpenAI 及其首席执行官山姆-阿尔特曼（Sam Altman）的诉讼，指控该公司将利润和商业利益置于公共利益之上。【原文：Billionaire Elon Musk has revived a lawsuit against ChatGPT-maker OpenAI and its CEO Sam Altman, alleging that the firm put profits and commercial interests ahead of the public good, the New York Times reported on Monday.】

item.title: 泰森食品公司因需求反弹、成本开始下降，季度业绩超出预期
item.description: 泰森食品公司（Tyson Foods）周一公布的第三季度收入和利润超出华尔街预期，表明市场对其肉类产品的需求正在回升，同时谷物价格下降也降低了动物饲料的成本。【原文：Tyson Foods surpassed Wall Street expectations for third-quarter revenue and profit on Monday, indicating that demand was rebounding for its meat products, while lower grain prices reduced costs for animal feed.】

item.title: 罗技创始人敦促公司立即更换董事会主席
item.description: 罗技国际公司联合创始人丹尼尔-博雷尔（Daniel Borel）周一敦促这家瑞士裔美国公司的股东们在今年找到一位新的董事会主席，以接替最近宣布不会在 2025 年竞选连任的温迪-贝克尔（Wendy Becker）。【原文：Logitech International co-founder Daniel Borel on Monday urged shareholders at the Swiss-American company to find a new board chairperson this year to replace Wendy Becker, who recently announced she would not stand for reelection in 2025.】

item.title: 据报道，士力架制造商玛氏有意收购凯兰诺瓦，凯兰诺瓦因此大涨
item.description: 据路透社报道，糖果巨头玛氏公司（Mars）正在探讨收购品客（Pringles）的可能性，随后品客生产商凯兰诺华（Kellanova）的股价在周一盘前交易中大涨超过 16%。【原文：Shares of Pringles maker Kellanova surged more than 16% in trading before the bell on Monday, after a Reuters report said candy giant Mars was exploring a potential buyout of the company.】

item.title: 数据疲软，交易员押注美联储大幅降息，美国收益率下滑
item.description: 周一，美国国债收益率暴跌，因为交易商开始为美联储大幅降息定价，此前疲软的就业数据加剧了人们对美国经济可能走向衰退的担忧。【原文：U.S. Treasury yields tumbled on Monday as traders moved to price in big rate cuts from the Federal Reserve, after weak jobs data stoked worries that the U.S. economy could be heading for a recession.】

item.title: 人工智能芯片初创公司 Groq 最新一轮融资后估值达 28 亿美元
item.description: 半导体初创公司 Groq 周一表示，在由思科投资公司（Cisco Investments）、三星催化剂基金（Samsung Catalyst Fund）和贝莱德私募股权合伙公司（BlackRock Private Equity Partners）等领投的 D 轮融资中，该公司已筹集到 6.4 亿美元，估值达到 28 亿美元。【原文：Semiconductor startup Groq said on Monday it has raised $640 million in a Series D funding round led by Cisco Investments, Samsung Catalyst Fund and BlackRock Private Equity Partners, among others, bringing its valuation to $2.8 billion.】

item.title: 霍尼韦尔自动化印度公司第一季度利润因订单执行而大幅增长
item.description: 工程公司霍尼韦尔自动化（Honeywell Automation）周一公布，受惠于现有订单的执行，第一季度利润增加。【原文：Engineering firm Honeywell Automation reported higher first-quarter profit on Monday, aided by execution of existing orders.】

item.title: 美国经济衰退担忧引发全球股市大跌，新兴市场股市暴跌
item.description: 周一，由于对美国经济衰退的担忧引发全球股市大跌，投资者纷纷转向日元等更安全的资产，全球新兴市场股市暴跌。【原文：Emerging market equities around the world tumbled on Monday, as fears of a recession in the United States sparked a global selloff and sent investors running for safer assets like the Japanese yen.】

item.title: Cemex 将以 9.5 亿美元的价格剥离多米尼加业务
item.description: 墨西哥水泥生产商 Cemex 周一宣布以约 9.5 亿美元的价格将其在多米尼加共和国的业务出售给 Cementos Progreso 和战略合作伙伴。【原文：Mexican cement maker Cemex on Monday announced the sale of its operations in the Dominican Republic to Cementos Progreso and strategic partners for about $950 million.】

item.title: 量子资本以 30 亿美元收购 Cogentrix，押注美国电力需求增长
item.description: 私募股权公司量子资本集团（Quantum Capital Group）周一表示，将以约 30 亿美元的价格从凯雷集团（Carlyle Group）管理的基金手中收购美国独立电力生产商 Cogentrix Energy。【原文：Private equity firm Quantum Capital Group will buy U.S. independent power producer Cogentrix Energy for about $3 billion from funds managed by the Carlyle Group , the companies said on Monday.】

item.title: 摩根大通首席执行官竞选人称市场复苏期间竞争激烈
item.description: 摩根大通的投资者们正在猜测谁将最终接替杰米-戴蒙出任首席执行官，其中两位竞争者表示，他们更专注于赢得市场份额和培养银行未来的领导者。【原文：As JPMorgan Chase investors puzzle over who will eventually replace Jamie Dimon as CEO, two of the contenders say they are more focused on winning market share and developing the bank's future leaders.】

item.title: 早间竞价：股市因 "R "字回归而下跌，日经指数下跌 12
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 礼来和诺和诺德在药店货架上展开减肥市场争夺战
item.description: 随着礼来公司的减肥药 Zepbound 在美国市场与诺和诺德公司的 Wegovy 展开竞争，一些医生表示，他们开处方的指导原则很简单：我的病人究竟能在药店买到哪种药？【原文：As Eli Lilly's weight-loss drug Zepbound gains ground in the U.S. against Novo Nordisk's Wegovy, some doctors say their guiding principle for writing prescriptions is simple: which drug can my patients actually get at the pharmacy?】
